21917:1-0,-24 2:19Jargo Nautilus0Undid revision 932265329 by Kiteinthewind (talk) Considering that Hong Kong has recently developed into a serious flashpoint in East Asia, I think we should aim to reduce the spread of misinformation regarding Hong Kong. Hong Kong is a sovereign territory of China (People's Republic) but it has high autonomy under international law, guaranteed until 2047.93226532916:00,24 21916:0-0,-24 2:19Kiteinthewind0Reverted good faith edits by Jargo Nautilus: If people read nothing but the short description of a long article on Wikipedia, then it is their problem. Why are we pandering to Chinese Nationalism here so much, that we have to stress where the sovereignty lies in Hong Kong? (TW)93219581303:00,24 21903:0-0,-24 2:19Jargo Nautilus0Undid revision 932136942 by Kiteinthewind (talk) If Hong Kong and Shanghai are both described as "Asian cities" then people will think they are administratively the same, when, in fact, they are totally different.93213694218:20,23 21918:2-0,-23 2:19Kiteinthewind0Edited description to “Asian city”. Short and sweet. People can read the page and understand it’s a Chinese SAR.93169212715:20,20 21915:2-0,-20 2:19Yungeditor0In an annual ranking of the Index of Economic Freedom, Hong Kong has come out on top for the 25th year in a row.93121473517:40,17 21917:4-0,-17 2:19Wefk4231→‎top: rearranged license plat prefix in infobox, weird to state cross-boundary vehicles before locals93114937307:10,17 21907:1-0,-17 2:19Peter Yeung1content correction93114767006:50,17 21906:5-0,-17 2:19Peter Yeung1content update93038549603:00,12 21903:0-0,-12 2:19HeisenbergPinkman093021481500:00,11 21900:0-0,-11 2:19Joeccho0→‎History93021435400:00,11 21900:0-0,-11 2:19Joeccho0→‎Education93021428700:00,11 21900:0-0,-11 2:19Joeccho0→‎Education92994670107:10,9 21907:1-0,-9 2:19Citation bot1Alter: title. If one categorize Indian and Nepalese as "others", it would be very strange to take the "white" from "others". (2) In the world, there is no ethnic group called "white". (3) Furthermore, the percentage of the so called "white" is only 0.8%, it would be more appropriate to put it in "others".92674427312:30,18 21912:3-0,-18 2:19SovanDara0→‎Political reforms and sociopolitical issues92646961416:30,16 21916:3-0,-16 2:19Dogdsmv342d092632330716:10,15 21916:1-0,-15 2:19YuriGagrin120Hong Kong does not have an official city status in China, it is instead a special administrative region.92629324311:40,15 21911:4-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092629303211:40,15 21911:4-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092629287611:30,15 21911:3-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092629264711:30,15 21911:3-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092629246311:30,15 21911:3-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092629230811:30,15 21911:3-0,-15 2:19Ivanlm78092560019003:30,11 21903:3-0,-11 2:19Sleath560Undid revision 925584160 by Ethanmayersweet (talk) - Courtesy to dialogue in talk first before making edit to the first line of lead. (talk) rm soapboxing91990434915:00,6 21915:0-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0Undid revision 919872794 by DOR (HK) (talk)purpose of lede is to summarise body (and sources explicitly deprecated in lede). If summary is objected to, the objection must be made on the basis that it fails to summarise body content or, if accurately summarised, to address the content, where this material is, far from being unsourced, supported by sources.91987279410:00,6 21910:0-0,-6 2:19DOR (HK)0→‎top: removed highly biased, unsourced editorializing91984727205:20,6 21905:2-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0source only makes that link for winter months, not for the rest of the year.91984689105:10,6 21905:1-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0summarise body content91984665505:10,6 21905:1-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0→‎Government and politics: character, with source91983314003:00,6 21903:0-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0→‎Government and politics: reflect current situation, with source91983283402:50,6 21902:5-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0→‎Government and politics: update to current status91982844802:20,6 21902:2-0,-6 2:19Sirlanz0→‎Political reforms and sociopolitical issues: any reform that does not achieve the direct elections sought is a failure; "partial" success is meaningless in this context91961671217:40,4 21917:4-0,-4 2:19Horserice0add lowest elevation and elevation points91959470315:20,4 21915:2-0,-4 2:19Horserice1the british already had de facto control in 1841. i'm not strictly arranging this section by chronology though. it's meant to be [prior administrative unit] and then [timeline]91954292709:10,4 21909:1-0,-4 2:19Feinoa1Treaty of Nanking should be first, since it happened before it became British Hong Kong91949486401:20,4 21901:2-0,-4 2:19Horserice1coordinate formatting91949459901:10,4 21901:1-0,-4 2:19Horserice0Whether they have an article or not is irrelevant. There's no widely agreed upon method of quantifying city influence. The rating would change depending on the firm doing the grading and what criteria they use. While this ranking *might* be useful depending on context in prose, it doesn't contribute to an objective introduction. Its usefulness is certainly dubious.91949102100:50,4 21900:5-0,-4 2:19Bluesatellite091949058700:40,4 21900:4-0,-4 2:19Bluesatellite091949017900:40,4 21900:4-0,-4 2:19Bluesatellite0there's nothing dubious about the ranking, it has its own article in Wikipedia91948939700:30,4 21900:3-0,-4 2:19Horserice1omit extra the91948933500:30,4 21900:3-0,-4 2:19Horserice0remove dubious ranking while maintaining emphasis on development91938477413:10,3 21913:1-0,-3 2:19Interinter3210One is the panoramic view of the Kowloon Peninsula and Hong Kong Island during the day, and the other is the representative night view of Victoria Harbour. The two show different characteristics and angles. They are not repeated, so one of them should not be regarded as cumbersome.91929242222:20,2 21922:2-0,-2 2:19Peter11700→‎Architecture: one skyline photo is enough91929215522:20,2 21922:2-0,-2 2:19Horserice1about and short descrip tweaks91926230918:40,2 21918:4-0,-2 2:19Kiteinthewind1deleted extraneous brackets91926223818:40,2 21918:4-0,-2 2:19Kiteinthewind0Self-reverted due to inadvertent error.
